body.name: Nichro Outdoor Patio Heater, 1500W Infrared Electric Heater with 9 Heat Levels, 24H Timer, Tip-Over Protection, Remote Control, Super Quiet Electric Patio Heater for Outdoor & Indoor Use
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 21 hrs 1 min
features: 【1S Rapid Heating】Enjoying quick warmth with our 1500W infrared heater that heats up in just 2 second, ensuring you stay comfortably cozy in no time.

【9 Heating Levels】Customizing your warmth with 9 heating levels(from 620W to 1500W), easily adjustable with the included remote control. Whether you need a gentle heat for a quiet evening or intense warmth for a chilly day, our outdoor electric heater has you covered.

【Super Quiet & 24H Timer】Enjoying a peaceful environment with our noiseless outdoor heater. The built-in 24H timer adds convenience, allowing you to set your preferred heating duration without any hassle.

【Safety First】Your well-being is our priority. Our outdoor patio heater is equipped with tip-over protection, ensuring worry-free use. With the waterproof and dustproof features, the portable electric heater is designed to withstand outdoor elements, providing safe & reliable heating.
【Outdoor & Indoor Comfort】Whether it's living room, office, garage, backyard, or patio, our electric indoor outdoor heater is versatile enough to meet your heating needs in any space.

【2-Year Warranty】Our outdoor electric patio heater comes with a 2-year warranty, providing you with confidence and peace of mind in your purchase. Stay warm and worry-free with our reliable and efficient infrared heater!

【Buying Tips】Restricted by home electricity standards, the infrared heater maximum power is not higher than 1500W, it has a great heating effect within 2m, please choose carefully according to the use of the situation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not enough heat
reviews.reviewText: We didn't feel like it put out enough heat, even on high. We returned it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It took me a while to figure out the touch display. You touch the power button to cycle up through the power levels and it goes to the top and the turns off (wraps around to the bottom to start over). I thought there was some way to go up and down, but nope. It's just up.I like the remote as well - super useful when you have it crazy hot and it gets crazy hot.It will pop a circuit breaker if shared with anything with a decent draw, so be sure to give it it's own 15 amps if you can (or keep it at lower levels) so you don't have to hunt down the circuit box and flip it back on.Also, it's radiation style only. It's like one of those old ones that looks like half a toaster, but instead of short and wide, it's tall and thin. I put a fan behind it to slowly blow the heat across, but again be careful of power draw.It says indoor, but it doesn't really feel like something you want indoor. Maybe in a pinch, but you at least want a fan if indoor.The "assembly" was pretty easy except the guard rail, that was weird. It's still weird, kind of loose and feels like an afterthought, poorly designed. But I'm glad it's there.It's also not super hot - it will warm a small area on high if it isn't too cold and little wind, but it's not like one of those big restaurant ones that heats up a whole table on a patio.Overall, solid product and feels like it will last a long time, but it was over $100 at order time, and at that price I just can't give it 5 stars. I almost gave it 3 stars. It's worth $50 or $60 maybe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heat up my life
reviews.reviewText: I use this for the indoor. It heats up very well I love the fact that it comes with a remote control. It's small so it doesn't take up a lot of space. The price is decent for what you're receiving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Worked great for a day
reviews.reviewText: First day worked great, heated a large area easily and quickly. Unfortunately the coil flashed the 2nd day and now looks like a burnt spot and the heater no longer works. Maybe this was a one off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not imporessed by the heat output.
reviews.reviewText: Good quality heater. The assembly is easy, but a bit annoying because of the base in 2 parts. It works great and the remote is responsive. As far has heating, it was mediocre for me. I tried it in my office and wasnt very effective. It heats only a small area around the heater itself, and without a fan to move the warm air around, it takes forever to feel any kind of heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This heater is described as an "Outdoor" heater. That's because it heats with radiant energy that warms people and objects in front of it rather than heating the air by convection. The directions make me wonder about the outdoor designation. They specifically say this is not intended for use in bathrooms, laundry rooms, or other wet areas. This is designed for 'dry' outdoor areas. Assembly is straightforward, just two screws into the base.I set this up on our patio and turned the heat level to high. It drew a full 15 amps from the outlet, so this has to be on a circuit by itself -- it can't have other devices drawing current, or it will trip the circuit breaker. I felt no significant heating until I got within 6 feet of the heater. Sitting more than 8 feet away from it, I didn't feel any heat at all. So, this is different from the typical propane radiant heaters that are effective at heating people 10-12 ft away. The heater seems durable, and it's operated without issue so far. It doesn't really seem like this would be used inside a house; maybe it is better for a small workshop. The electric coils glow brightly, like a toaster, and they aren't safe around kids who might wander too close or put their fingers into the hot coils.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This seems to work pretty darn good. Had it turned on out in the garage yesterday during a chilly day. It lit up pretty fast (although it didn't spew out fire like the illustration here. Sad... ) I only had it up about half way -- level 4 -- and it did a decent job while I worked out there. I probably should have went full tilt with it (if only to see it blasting that fire out) but I did not. That day will come soon, though. I like that it has a remote to use away from it and that it has a safety bar so no one can stand close enough to it and catch on fire. That's probably a good safety measure. Good deal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Heats up my enclosed front porch
reviews.reviewText: It heats up my enclosed front porch but the heat doesn’t last long at all.
